Customize tab with the server's dpp::onboarding_prompt
"16:20" Browse Channels tab
Server Guide.
Guild navigation types for dpp::utility::guild_navigation()
"20 April 2021" - Long Date
"Tuesday, 20 April 2021 16:20" - Long Date/Time
"2 months ago" - Relative Time
"16:20:30" - Long Time
"20/04/2021" - Short Date
"20 April 2021 16:20" - Short Date/Time
"16:20" - Short Time
Timestamp formats for dpp::utility::timestamp()

simplesect.para: These values are the actual character values specified by the Discord API and should not be changed unless the Discord API changes the specification! They have been sorted into numerical order of their ASCII value to keep C++ happy.

briefdescription.para: Callback for the results of a command executed via dpp::utility::exec.

parameterdescription.para: Return type to check for convertibility to
Arguments to use to resolve the overload

simplesect.para: Whether the expression F(Args...) is convertible to R

briefdescription.para: The base URL for CDN content such as profile pictures and guild icons.
The base URL for message/user/channel links.
Get the url query parameter for the cdn endpoint. Internally used to build url getters.

parameterdescription.para: size to generate url parameter for. Must be any power of two between 16 and 4096 (inclusive) or it'll return an empty string.

simplesect.para: std::string url query parameter e.g. ?size=128, or an empty string

briefdescription.para: Convert a byte count to display value.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< image_type > &allowed_formats, const std::string &path_without_extension, const dpp::image_type format, uint16_t size, bool prefer_animated=false, bool is_animated=false)
memberdef.name: cdn_endpoint_url

briefdescription.para: Helper function to easily create discord's cdn endpoint urls.

parameterdescription.para: A vector of supported formats for the endpoint from the discord docs
The path for the endpoint (without the extension e.g. .png)
the wished format to return. Must be one of the formats passed in allowed_formats, otherwise it returns an empty string

the image size which will be appended as a querystring to the url. It must be any power of two between 16 and 4096, otherwise no querystring will be appended (discord then returns the image as their default size)
Whether the user prefers gif format. If true, it'll return gif format whenever the image is available as animated. In this case, the format-parameter is only used for non-animated images.
Whether the image is actually animated or not

simplesect.para: std::string endpoint url or empty string

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< image_type > &allowed_formats, const std::string &path_without_extension, const std::string &hash, const dpp::image_type format, uint16_t size, bool prefer_animated=false, bool is_animated=false)
memberdef.name: cdn_endpoint_url_hash

briefdescription.para: Helper function to easily create discord's cdn endpoint urls.

parameterdescription.para: A vector of supported formats for the endpoint from the discord docs
The path for the endpoint (without the extension e.g. .png)
The hash (optional). If not empty, it will be prefixed with a_ for animated images (is_animated=true)
the wished format to return. Must be one of the formats passed in allowed_formats, otherwise it returns an empty string

the image size which will be appended as a querystring to the url. It must be any power of two between 16 and 4096, otherwise no querystring will be appended (discord then returns the image as their default size)
Whether the user prefers gif format. If true, it'll return gif format whenever the image is available as animated. In this case, the format-parameter is only used for non-animated images.
Whether the image is actually animated or not

simplesect.para: std::string endpoint url or empty string

briefdescription.para: Helper function to easily create discord's cdn endpoint urls (specialised for stickers)

parameterdescription.para: The sticker ID. Returns empty string if 0

simplesect.para: std::string endpoint url or empty string

briefdescription.para: Run a commandline program asynchronously. The command line program is spawned in a separate std::thread, and when complete, its output from stdout is passed to the callback function in its string parameter. For example:

parameterdescription.para: Command line parameters. Each will be escaped using std::quoted.
The callback to call on completion.

briefdescription.para: Build a URL parameter string e.g. "?a=b&c=d&e=f" from a map of key/value pairs. Entries with empty key names or zero values are omitted.

briefdescription.para: Escapes Discord's markdown sequences in a string.

parameterdescription.para: If set to false, then code blocks are not escaped. This means that you can still use a code block, and the text within will be left as-is. If set to true, code blocks will also be escaped so that ` symbol may be used as a normal character.

simplesect.para: std::string The text with the markdown special characters escaped with a backslash

briefdescription.para: Read a whole file into a std::string.

simplesect.para: This function can take a while if this is a large file, causing events to not reply and also taking up a lot of memory. Make sure you have enough memory, and use dpp::interaction_create_t::thinking in events where you call this function on big files.
Be aware this function can block! If you are regularly reading large files, consider caching them.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file to read

simplesect.para: std::string The file contents

parameterdescription.para: on failure to read the entire file

briefdescription.para: Validate a string value In the event the length of the string is less than _min, then an exception of type dpp:length_exception will be thrown. If the string is longer than _max UTF8 codepoints it will be truncated to fit.
